item.description:
Hi all,
Honestly, I couldn't decide on which movie to host this Sunday afternoon- Waitress or Paprika.Waitress is a slice-of-life comedy and Paprika is an anime feature concerning dreams. I opted for Paprika on the strength of Ty Burr's review and another reference to this film as being a more adult-centric version of Howl's Moving Castle (this got me giddy just thinking about it).

Here's the description from AllMovieGuide: Groundbreaking animator Satoshi Kon (whose credits include Tokyo Godfathers, Millennium Actress, and Perfect Blue) directed this visually spectacular adaptation of a science fiction novel by Yatsutaka Tsutsui. Atsuko is a psychiatrist who uses advanced technology to study the human mind. Atsuko has developed a machine that will allow her to enter the dreams of her patients and study their psyches from the inside. Atsuko also does double duty as Paprika, a high-tech detective who uses this new innovation to find out the truth about what the people she's trailing really think. However, Atsuko falls victim to a thief who steals the one-of-a-kind machine, and Paprika sets out to find it as a wave of psychological instability tears through the city.

Here's Ty Burr's rave review: http://www.boston.com...

Tom will be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row after the film and then we will go to a local restaurant to discuss.

Actual screening time is 4:40.
item.name: Paprika- Japanese Anime at Kendall on Sunday Afternoon
